intro: Ruellia drymophila, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have a velvety texture. Ruellia drymophila is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partially shaded conditions.
